availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Henry Willis (Barren County, Kentucky, farmer )

body.p: Barren County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary W. Tisdale Willis in Barren County, Kentucky, on December 24, 1851. Father of Charles T. Willis, Simon C. Willis, W. James Willis, Jane E. Willis, George M. Willis, and Sallie Willis. Farmer in Barren County in 1850. Employed in Barren County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Division 1, p. 307B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, District 2, pp. 1029-1030.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, Caverna, p. 258B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Barren County Marriages, Film #000209757, p. 4.
Find A Grave, "William Henry Willis (1829-1899)," Memorial #106340598, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/106340598 (accessed June 7, 2020).
